alert.note: Alert for Massac (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 9:19PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Massac, northwestern Calloway, southwestern Livingston, western Marshall, eastern Carlisle, northeastern Hickman, southeastern Ballard, McCracken and Graves Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 919 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Barlow to near Fulgham. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lovelaceville around 930 PM CDT. Barkley Regional Airport around 935 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Paducah, Mayfield, West Paducah, Metropolis, Lone Oak, Brookport, Reidland, Benton and Ledbetter. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 1 and 22. Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 37 and 38. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 14 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
